H0.text: where are antibodies made and by what type of lymphocyte. Bone Marrow

H1.text: where are antibodies made and by what type of lymphocyte. Spleen

H2.text: where are antibodies made and by what type of lymphocyte. Thymus

H3.text: where are antibodies made and by what type of lymphocyte. lymph

A4.text: Resultant plasma cells migrate to bone marrow.

A5.text: Resultant plasma cells stay within the SLO.

A6.text: Long‑lived plasma cells reside in the bone marrow and secrete antibodies for decades.

A7.text: Short‑lived cells remain in the extramedullary regions of lymph nodes.
